Key Match Events: Bradley Barcola scored in the opening minute for France.
Federico Dimarco volleyed home a deft back-heel flicked pass from Sandro Tonali to level the score for Italy.
Davide Frattesi put Italy ahead five minutes after the interval.
Giacomo Raspadori scored the third goal for Italy in the 74th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Both sides came into the game looking for redemption after failing to impress at Euro 2024.
Post-Match Reflections: Italy manager Luciano Spalletti praised Sandro Tonali's performance, stating, 'We found a very strong player again.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Parc des Princes with an attendance of 44,956.
Sandro Tonali returned to the side after serving a 10-month ban for breaching betting rules.
